abstract.p: Wireless division of Spring Corp will make voice-activated dialing and information services available on its national wireless network (S)

block.p: In a move aimed at advancing the use of voice-based technology, Sprint PCS, the wireless division of the Sprint Corporation, will make voice-activated dialing and information services available on its national wireless network. Using technology developed by Nuance Communications, customers will be able to initiate calls or gain access to directory services by speaking into their phones, at monthly fees of $10 for individuals and $5 for businesses. In addition, Sprint is working with Ford Motor to make voice-activated services available for vehicles.
